{"id":415194979,"lang":"python3","time":"8Â months","timestamp":1604145679,"status_display":"Accepted","runtime":"72 ms","url":"/submissions/detail/415194979/","is_pending":"Not Pending","title":"Recover Binary Search Tree","memory":"14.3 MB","code":"# Definition for a binary tree node.\n# class TreeNode:\n#     def __init__(self, val=0, left=None, right=None):\n#         self.val = val\n#         self.left = left\n#         self.right = right\nclass Solution:\n    def recoverTree(self, root: TreeNode) -> None:\n        \"\"\"\n        Do not return anything, modify root in-place instead.\n        O(n) time | O(1) space\n        \"\"\"\n        self.outOfOrder = None\n        self.prev = None\n        self.low = None\n        def inOrder(node):\n            if node is None:\n                return\n            inOrder(node.left)\n            if self.low is not None:\n                self.low = min(self.low, node, key=lambda x: x.val)\n            elif self.prev is not None and self.prev.val > node.val:\n                self.low = node\n                self.outOfOrder = self.prev\n            self.prev = node\n            inOrder(node.right)\n                    \n        inOrder(root)\n        self.outOfOrder.val, self.low.val = self.low.val, self.outOfOrder.val","compare_result":"","title_slug":"recover-binary-search-tree"}
